Name: Ardha Matsyendrasana
English: Half Lord of the Fishes Pose
Etymology: Ardha = half; Matsyendra = lord of the fishes
Open: Hip extensors, external rotators of the leg, obliques, back extensors, chest, internal rotators of the arm, neck rotators.
OpenAsana: [[Baddhakoṇāsana B]], [[Mṛgāsana]], Eka Pada Raj Koundinyasana Prep, [[Jānuśīrṣāsana A]], [[Marīchyāsana C]], [[Padmāsana]], [[Parivṛttatrikoṇāsana]], [[Parivṛttotkaṭāsana]], [[Supta Matsyendrāsana]], [[Vīrabhadrāsana A]].
Stable: Hip flexors, hip adductors, obliques, knee flexors, shoulder retractors and protractors.
StableAsana: [[Adhomukhaśvānāsana]], [[Baddhakoṇāsana B]], [[Bālāsana]], [[Garuḍāsana]], [[Gomukhāsana B]], [[Supta Matsyendrāsana]], [[Marīchyāsana A]] and C, [[Padmāsana]], [[Parivṛttapārśvakoṇāsana]], [[Parivṛttatrikoṇāsana]], [[Prasāritapādottānāsana A]].

Name: Baddha Hasta Sirsasana A
Etymology: Baddha = bound; Hasta = hand; Śīrṣa = head

Name: Baddha Hasta Sirsasana B
Etymology: Baddha = bound; Hasta = hand; Śīrṣa = head

Name: Baddha Hasta Sirsasana C
Etymology: Baddha = bound; Hasta = hand; Śīrṣa = head

Name: Bakasana B
Open: Wrist flexors, shoulder elevators and retractors, back extensors, hip extensors, ankle dorsiflexors.
Stable: Wrist synergists, elbow synergists, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis flexors, protractors), external rotators of the arm, chest, abdominals, hip adductors and flexors, pelvic floor, knee flexors.
Preparation: [[Tiṭṭibhāsana A]], [[Pārśvabakāsana]], [[Kouṇḍinyāsana A]], [[Śīrṣāsana B]] series, transition to pose by hopping from [[Adhomukhaśvānāsana]].

Name: Bharadvajasana
Open: Padma leg: hip adductors, internal rotators of the leg. Vira leg: external rotators of the leg, knee flexors, foot dorsiflexors. Hip extensors, obliques, chest. Bound arm: Shoulder flexors, external rotators of the arm. Shoulder elevators, neck rotators.
OpenAsana: [[Ardhabaddhapadmottānāsana]] Prep, [[Bharmanāsana]], [[Gomukhāsana B]] arms, Jathara Parivarttanasana, [[Padmāsana]], [[Parivṛttotkaṭāsana]], [[Vīrabhadrāsana A]].
Stable: Pelvic floor, hip flexors, knee flexors, obliques, shoulder extensors.

Name: Bhekasana
Open: Hip flexors, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors, abdominals, chest, shoulder elevators and flexors, throat.
OpenAsana: [[Rājakapotāsana]], [[Dhanurāsana]], [[Prasāritapādottānāsana C]] arms, [[Śalabhāsana A]] and [[Śalabhāsana B]], [[Uṣṭrāsana]], [[Vīrabhadrāsana A]].
Stable: Back extensors, transversus abdominis, pelvic floor, shoulders (emphasis flexors, protractors and adductors), neck.

Name: Dhanurasana
Open: External rotators of the leg, hip flexors, abdominals, chest, shoulder protractors and extensors, internal rotators of the arm, elbow flexors, wrist flexors.
Stable: Back extensors, hip extensors and adductors, transversus abdominis, shoulder retractors, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors.

Name: Dwi Pada Sirsasana
Etymology: Dvi = two; Pāda = foot; Śīrṣa = head
Open: Hip adductors and extensors, internal rotators of the leg, back extensors, shoulder retractors and elevators.
OpenAsana: [[Ānandabālāsana]], [[Ardhabaddhapadmottānāsana]], [[Ardhabaddhapadmapaścimottānāsana]], [[Agnistambhāsana]], [[Baddhakoṇāsana B]], [[Baddhapadmāsana]], [[Bhujapīḍāsana]], [[Ekapādarājakapotāsana]], [[Ekapādaśīrṣāsana]], [[Gomukhāsana B]], [[Karṇapīḍāsana]], [[Kūrmāsana]], [[Mālāsana]], [[Marīchyāsana C]], [[Pādahastāsana]], [[Prasāritapādottānāsana A]], [[Prasāritapādottānāsana B]], and [[Prasāritapādottānāsana D]], [[Upaviṣṭhakoṇāsana A]], [[Ekapādabakāsana A]]
Stable: Hip flexors and adductors, pelvic floor, abdominals, knee flexors, shoulder retractors and adductors.
StableAsana: [[Agnistambhāsana]], [[Baddhakoṇāsana B]], [[Ekapādarājakapotāsana]], [[Ekapādaśīrṣāsana]], [[Karṇapīḍāsana]], [[Marīchyāsana A]], [[Padmāsana]], [[Prasāritapādottānāsana A]], [[Prasāritapādottānāsana B]], and [[Prasāritapādottānāsana D]], [[Ubhayapādāṅguṣṭhāsana]], [[Upaviṣṭhakoṇāsana A]], [[Ūrdhvamukhapaścimottānāsana]], [[Ekapādabakāsana A]].

Name: Eka Pada Sirsasana A
Etymology: Eka = one; Pāda = foot; Śīrṣa = head
Open: Grounded leg: hip synergists, external rotators of the leg, knee flexors, calf. Sirsa leg: hip adductors and extensors, internal rotators of the leg. Back extensors, shoulder elevators, chest.
Stable: Hip flexors and adductors. Grounded leg: internal rotators of the leg, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors. Gesture leg: external rotators, knee flexors. Transversus abdominis, back extensors, obliques, shoulder retractors.

Name: Gomukhasana B
Open: Hip adductors, extensors, and rotators. Back extensors, shoulder retractors and elevators. Top arm: shoulder and elbow extensors. Bottom arm: shoulder flexors, external rotators of the arm.
Stable: Hip flexors and adductors, external rotators of the leg, pelvic floor, transversus abdominis, knee flexors. Lower arm: internal rotators, shoulder extensors. Upper Arm: shoulder flexors, protractors, and adductors, elbow flexors.

Name: Kapotasana A
Open: Knee flexors, hip flexors, foot dorsiflexors, abdominals, chest, shoulder elevators and flexors, upper back muscles, wrist flexors.
Stable: Wrist synergists, elbow flexors, external rotators of the arm, chest, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis adductors, protractors, and retractors), neck, transversus abdominis, back extensors, hip adductors and flexors, knee flexors, calves.

Name: Krounchasana
Open: [[Vīrabhadrāsana A]] leg: foot dorsiflexors, knee extensors. Extended leg: hip extensors, knee flexors. Shoulder elevators.
Stable: Hip flexors and adductors, internal rotators of the leg, back extensors, abdominals, shoulder depressors and flexors. Extended leg: knee extensors, calf.
Preparation: Pick up and float back to [[Chaturāṅgadaṇḍāsana]], [[Ekapādaśīrṣāsana]] to [[Cakorāsana]] vinyasa; [[Ubhayapādāṅguṣṭhāsana]], [[Ūrdhvamukhapaścimottānāsana]].

Name: Laghu Vajrasana
Open: Knee extensors, hip flexors, abdominals, shoulder extensors, elbow extensors, chest, throat.
OpenAsana: [[Vajrāsana A]], [[Uṣṭrāsana]] and its Prep poses, [[Vīrabhadrāsana A]].
Stable: Knee extensors, hip adductors and extensors, internal rotators of the leg, back extensors, transversus abdominis, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis retractors/protractors, extensors), internal rotators of the arm, elbow flexors.

Name: Mukta Hasta Sirsasana A
Etymology: Mukta = free; Hasta = hand; Śīrṣa = head

Name: Mukta Hasta Sirsasana C
Etymology: Mukta = free; Hasta = hand; Śīrṣa = head

Name: Mukta Hasta Sirsasana C
Etymology: Mukta = free; Hasta = hand; Śīrṣa = head

Name: Parighasana
Open: Standing leg: calf, knee flexors, hip extensors, external rotators of the leg. Gesture leg: foot dorsiflexors, knee flexors, hip flexors. Obliques, chest, shoulder retractors and elevators.
OpenAsana: [[Parivṛttatrikoṇāsana]] and its Prep poses, [[Vīrabhadrāsana C]] and its Prep poses.
Stable: Standing leg: intrinsic foot muscles, hip stabilizers (emphasis flexors, adductors). Extended leg: hip extensors. Knee extensors, back extensors, transversus abdominis, obliques, shoulder retractors and protractors, elbow extensors, neck.
Preparation: Clasp lifted-side foot with lifted hand, transition to [[Vīrabhadrāsana C]], [[Adhomukhavṛkṣāsana]], then [[Chaturāṅgadaṇḍāsana]]. Do not transition directly to [[Ardhacandrāsana]].

Name: Pincha Mayurasana
Open: Internal rotators of the arm, shoulder elevators and retractors, hip flexors, knee flexors.
Stable: Wrist flexor/extensors, elbow flexors, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis protractors, flexors), internal rotators of the arm, abdominals, back extensors, hip stabilizers, internal rotators of the leg, knee extensors, calves.
Preparation: [[Viparīccakrāsana]], [[Adhomukhavṛkṣāsana]], transition to [[Dvipādaviparītadaṇḍāsana]] (feet all the way down to the floor, extend legs).

Name: Shalabhasana A
Open: All: abdominals, hip flexors, knee flexors, foot dorsiflexors, chest, shoulder elevators, neck. A and C: shoulder flexors. B: shoulder extensors.
Stable: Back extensors, hip extensors and adductors, transversus abdominis, shoulder retractors, neck, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors. A: shoulder extensors, elbow flexors, wrist synergists. B: Shoulder flexors, external rotators of the arm, elbow extensors. C: Shoulder extensors and adductors, wrist synergists.
StableAsana: [[Bharmanāsana]]. The Salabhasana poses are themselves prep for general practice and all back bends.

Name: Tittibhasana A
Open: Wrist flexors, elbow flexors, shoulder flexors, back extensors, hip adductors and extensors, knee flexors, ankle dorsiflexors.
Stable: Wrist synergists, elbow synergists, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis flexors, protractors), external rotators of the arm, chest, abdominals, hip adductors and flexors, pelvic floor, knee extensors, calves.
StableAsana: [[Adhomukhaśvānāsana]], [[Bakāsana B]], [[Bālāsana]], [[Bharmanāsana]], [[Chaturāṅgadaṇḍāsana]], [[Kouṇḍinyāsana B]], [[Kūrmāsana]], [[Mālāsana]], [[Marīchyāsana A]], [[Nāvāsana]], [[Parivṛtta Jānuśīrṣāsana]], [[Prasāritapādottānāsana A]], [[Śīrṣāsana]]I, [[Upaviṣṭhakoṇāsana A]], [[Ūrdhvakukkutāsana]], [[Ekapādabakāsana A]].

Name: Ustrasana
Open: Foot dorsiflexors, knee extensors, abdominals, chest, throat, elbow flexors.
Stable: Knee extensors, hip adductors and extensors, internal rotators of the leg, back extensors, abdominals, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis retractors, extensors), external rotators of the arm, elbow flexors.

Name: Trianga Mukhottanasana A
Etymology: Tri = three, anga = limb, mukha = face/intense, uttana = stretch.

Name: Trianga Mukhottanasana B
Etymology: Tri = three, anga = limb, mukha = face/intense, uttana = stretch.

Name: Urdhva Dhanurasana
Etymology: Ūrdhva = upward; Dhanu = bow; Āsana = posture
Open: Hip flexors, external rotators of the leg, abdominals, chest, shoulder elevators, retractors and extensors, wrist flexors.
Stable: Wrist synergists, elbow extensors, external rotators of the arm, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis retractors, protractors, flexors), back extensors, transversus abdominis, hip extensors and adductors, intrinsic foot muscles.
Preparation: Maintaining parallel positioning of the feet, move hands closer to the feet; Eka Pada [[Ūrdhva Dhanurāsana]], [[Dvipādaviparītadaṇḍāsana]], drop-backs, ticktocks.

Name: Viparita Chakrasana
Open: Wrist flexors, shoulder elevators and retractors, throat, chest, abdominals, hip flexors.
Stable: Wrist flexors, elbow flexors, external rotators of the arm, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis retractors, protractors, flexors), back extensors, transversus abdominis, hip flexors and adductors.
Preparation: With [[Adhomukhavṛkṣāsana]] arms: Drop into [[Ūrdhva Dhanurāsana]], ticktocks.

Name: Halasana
Open: Foot dorsiflexors, knee extensors, hip extensors, back extensors.
Stable: Shoulder stabilizers (emphasis retractors, adductors, extensors), back extensors, hip extensors and adductors, internal rotators of the leg, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors.

Name: Karna Pidasana
Open: Elbow flexors, shoulder flexors, back extensors, hip extensors.
Stable: Shoulder stabilizers (emphasis retractors, adductors, extensors), elbow extensors, back extensors, hip flexors, internal rotators of the leg, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors.

Name: Matsyasana
Open: Knee extensors, hip adductors and extensors, internal rotators of the leg. Abdominals, chest, shoulder flexors, throat.
Stable: Hip flexors, adductors, internal rotators of the leg, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors, back extensors, transversus abdominis, shoulder retractors and extensors, elbow extensors, neck.

Name: Padmasana
Open: Hip adductors and extensors, internal rotators of the leg, knee extensors.
OpenAsana: [[Baddhakoṇāsana B]], [[Daṇḍāsana]], [[Ekapādarājakapotāsana]] and its Prep poses, [[Gomukhāsana B]], [[Vīrabhadrāsana A]].
Stable: Hip flexors, external rotators of the leg, pelvic floor, transversus abdominis, back extensors, knee flexors, shoulder retractors and protractors.

Name: Sarvangasana
Open: Hip extensors, knee flexors.
OpenAsana: A deeply restorative asana that can be practiced on its own or after any sequence.
Stable: Hip adductors.
StableAsana: In itself a restorative that can be practiced independently or after any practice.
Preparation: Strap thighs together, place sandbag over feet; explore wall-supported Ardha [[Sarvāṅgāsana]] or [[Suptakoṇāsana]].

Name: Savasana
Open: Everything.
Stable: The floor—somewhat.
Preparation: Often sequenced as the final pose of the practice; restorative pose, slowly transition up to sitting.
Counterposes: At the end of practice, allow at least five minutes in this asana; practice a shorter hold within an asana practice.

Name: Sirsasana A
Open: Shoulder extensors and retractors.
Stable: Elbow synergists, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis flexors, protractors, retractors), neck, obliques, abdominals, back extensors, hip flexors, adductors, and extensors, internal rotators of the leg, knee extensors.
Preparation: Twist to each side; fold legs into [[Padmāsana]] position, Parsvaikapada Sirsasana, Urdhva [[Daṇḍāsana]].

Name: Urdhva Padmasana
Open: Neck, hip adductors and extensors, internal rotators of the leg, knee extensors.
Stable: Shoulder stabilizers (emphasis retractors, adductors), neck, elbow extensors, back extensors, hip extensors, abdominals.
Preparation: In [[Sarvāṅgāsana]]: transition to [[Piṇḍāsana]], or lift knees up to extend Lotus and revolve to one side, then the other (one hand to sacrum); transition to Mayurasana.

Name: Utplutih
Open: Wrist flexors, elbow flexors, shoulder elevators, retractors, and flexors, back extensors, hip adductors and extensors, internal rotators of the leg, knee extensors.
OpenAsana: [[Padmāsana]] and its Prep poses, abdominal core work.
Stable: Wrist synergists, elbow synergists, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis flexors, protractors), external rotators of the arm, chest, abdominals, hip adductors and flexors, external rotators of the leg, pelvic floor, knee flexors, foot dorsiflexors.

Name: Uttana Padasana
Open: Abdominals, chest, throat, shoulder elevators, knee flexors, foot dorsiflexors.
Stable: Hip flexors, adductors, internal rotators of the leg, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors, back extensors, transversus abdominis, shoulder retractors, protractors, and flexors, elbow extensors, neck.

Name: Adho Mukha Vrksasana
Open: Wrist flexors, shoulder extensors, back extensors, hip flexors, knee flexors.
OpenAsana: [[Adhomukhaśvānāsana]], [[Bharmanāsana]], [[Piñchamayūrāsana]], [[Tāḍāsana]], [[Phalakāsana]], [[Ūrdhva Dhanurāsana]]. For arms and shoulders, these respective arm forms: [[Tāḍāsana]], [[Gomukhāsana B]], [[Garuḍāsana]].
Stable: Wrist synergists, elbow synergists, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis flexors, protractors, retractors), obliques, abdominals, back extensors, hip flexors, adductors, and extensors, internal rotators of the leg, knee extensors.

Name: Astavakrasana
Etymology: Named after Sage Aṣṭavakra (a sage with eight bends)
Open: Wrist flexors, shoulder elevators and flexors, chest, obliques, knee flexors, hip extensors and abductors.
Stable: Wrist synergists, elbow synergists, rotators of the arm, chest, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis adductors, protractors, retractors) obliques, abdominals, hip adductors and flexors, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors.

Name: Bhairavasana
Etymology: Named after Bhairava, a fierce form of Shiva

Name: Dvipada Viparita Dandasana
Etymology: Dvipāda = two-legged; Viparīta = inverted; Daṇḍa = staff
Open: Shoulder elevators, extensors, and retractors, chest, abdominals, hip flexors, knee flexors, foot dorsiflexors.
OpenAsana: [[Adhomukhaśvānāsana]], [[Añjanēyāsana]], [[Gomukhāsana B]], [[Pūrvottānāsana]], [[Ūrdhva Dhanurāsana]], [[Baddhakoṇāsana A]], [[Vajrāsana A]], [[Ūrdhva Dhanurāsana]], [[Vīrabhadrāsana A]].
Stable: Wrist flexors, elbow flexors, external rotators of the arm, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis retractors, protractors, flexors), back extensors, transversus abdominis, hip extensors and adductors, intrinsic foot muscles.
Preparation: Eka Pada variation; walk feet in and transition to [[Piñchamayūrāsana]].

Name: Eka Pada Bakasana A
Etymology: Eka = one; Pāda = foot; Baka = crane
Open: Wrist flexors, shoulder elevators and flexors, obliques, hip extensors. Folded leg: hip adductors, internal rotators of the leg. Extended leg: knee flexors foot dorsiflexors.
OpenAsana: Arkarna [[Daṇḍāsana]], [[Aṣṭavakrāsana]], [[Bakāsana B]], [[Ekapādarājakapotāsana]] Prep poses, [[Galavāsana]], [[Marīchyāsana A]] and C.
Stable: Front leg: hip adductors and extensors, internal rotators of the leg, knee synergists. Back leg: internal rotators of the leg, knee flexors. Abdominals, transversus abdominis, chest, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis protractors, flexors), external rotators of the arm, elbow synergists, wrist flexors.

Name: Eka Pada Bakasana B
Etymology: Eka = one; Pāda = foot; Baka = crane

Name: Eka Pada Koundinyasana A
Etymology: Eka = one; Pāda = foot; Named after Sage Koundinya
Open: Wrist flexors, shoulder elevators, chest, obliques, back extensors. Front leg: hip extensors, external rotators of the leg, knee flexors. Back leg: hip flexors, knee extensors.
Stable: Wrist synergists, elbow synergists, rotators of the arm, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis protractors, retractors, adductors, flexors), chest, obliques, abdominals, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors. Lower leg: hip flexors and adductors. Upper leg: hip extensors.
Preparation: Transition to [[Chaturāṅgadaṇḍāsana]], add to [[Śīrṣāsana B]] vinyasa, [[Kouṇḍinyāsana A]], [[Galavāsana]].

Name: Eka Pada Koundinyasana B
Etymology: Eka = one; Pāda = foot; Named after Sage Koundinya
Open: Wrist flexors, shoulder elevators, chest, hip adductors. Front leg: hip extensors, internal rotators of the leg, knee flexors. Back leg: hip flexors, knee extensors.
Stable: Wrist synergists, elbow synergists, rotators of the arm, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis protractors, retractors, adductors, flexors), chest, obliques, abdominals, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors. Propped leg: hip flexors and adductors. Back leg: hip extensors, knee extensors.
Preparation: Transition to [[Chaturāṅgadaṇḍāsana]], [[Kouṇḍinyāsana A]], [[Kouṇḍinyāsana A]] A, [[Galavāsana]], add to [[Śīrṣāsana B]] vinyasa.

Name: Ekapada Raja Kapotasana
Etymology: Ekapāda = one-legged; Rāja = king; Kapota = pigeon
Open: Front leg: hip adductors and extensors, internal rotators of the leg, knee extensors. Back leg: hip flexors, external rotators of the leg, knee flexors. Abdominals, chest, shoulder extensors, retractors and elevators, neck.
OpenAsana: [[Adhomukhaśvānāsana]], [[Ūrdhvamukhaśvānāsana]], [[Añjanēyāsana]], [[Ālāsana]], [[Baddhakoṇāsana B]], [[Rājakapotāsana]], [[Garuḍāsana]] arms, [[Gomukhāsana B]], [[Baddhakoṇāsana A]], [[Ekapādabakāsana A]], [[Vīrabhadrāsana A]].
Stable: Pelvic floor. Front leg: hip flexors and abductors, knee flexors, foot dorsiflexors. Back leg: hip extensors and adductors, internal rotators of the leg, knee synergists. Transversus abdominis, back extensors, shoulder protractors and flexors, external rotators of the arm.

Name: Ekapada Viparita Dandasana
Etymology: Ekapāda = one-legged; Viparīta = inverted; Daṇḍa = staff

Name: Galavasana
Open: Wrist flexors, shoulder elevators, retractors. Folded leg: hip extensors and adductors, internal rotators of the leg. Extended leg: hip flexors, knee flexors.
OpenAsana: [[Bakāsana B]] and its Prep poses, [[Ekapādarājakapotāsana]] and its Prep poses, [[Utkaṭāsana]].
Stable: Wrist synergists, elbow synergists, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis flexors, protractors), external rotators of the arm, chest abdominals. Grounded leg: external rotators, hip flexors, knee flexors. Extended leg: hip extensors, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors.

Name: Ganda Bherundasana
Etymology: Gaṇḍa = fierce; Bheruṇḍa = a mythical bird

Name: Hanumanasana
Etymology: Named after Hanuman, the monkey god
Open: Front leg: calf, knee flexors, hip extensors. Back leg: knee flexors, hip flexors. Abdominals, shoulder retractors, elevators, and extensors, elbow flexors.
Stable: Pelvic floor, back extensors, transversus abdominis, hip stabilizers (emphasis flexors, adductors, and rear leg hip extensors), internal rotators of the leg, shoulder flexors, protractors, internal rotators and adductors of the arm, elbow extensors.

Name: Nata Rajasana A
Open: Standing leg: knee flexors. Gesture leg: hip flexors, external rotators, foot dorsiflexors. Abdominals, chest, shoulder extensors and elevators, throat.
OpenAsana: [[Adhomukhaśvānāsana]], [[Añjanēyāsana]], [[Ekapādarājakapotāsana]], [[Gomukhāsana B]], [[Baddhakoṇāsana A]], [[Vajrāsana A]], [[Tāḍāsana]], [[Ūrdhva Dhanurāsana]], [[Utthitahastapādāṅguṣṭhāsana A]], [[Vīrabhadrāsana A]] and [[Virabhadrāsana C]].
Stable: Standing leg: intrinsic foot muscles, knee extensors. Pelvic floor, back extensors, transversus abdominis, hip stabilizers (emphasis flexors, adductors, and rear leg hip extensors), internal rotators of the leg, shoulder flexors, protractors. Bound arm: internal rotators, elbow extensors.

Name: Purna Matsyendrasana
English: Full Lord of the Fishes Pose
Etymology: Pūrṇa = full; Named after Sage Matsyendra

Name: Raja Kapotasana
Open: Knee flexors, hip flexors, abdominals, chest, shoulder elevators and flexors, wrist flexors.
OpenAsana: [[Bharmanāsana]]. In it’s gradual expression, an  pose for back bends.
Stable: Wrist flexors, elbow flexors, rotators of the arm, chest, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis adductors, protractors, and retractors), transversus abdominis, spine extensors, hip extensors, knee extensors, calves.
StableAsana: [[Bharmanāsana]]. In its gradual expression, a preparatory pose for back bends.

Name: Skandasana
Etymology: Named after Skanda, the warrior god

Name: Supta Trivikramasana
Etymology: Supta = reclined; Trivikrama = three steps (an epithet of Vishnu)

Name: Urdhva Kukkutasana
Open: Wrist flexors, elbow flexors, shoulder elevators and retractors, back extensors, hip adductors and extensors, internal rotators of the leg, knee extensors.
OpenAsana: [[Bakāsana B]] and its Prep poses, [[Padmāsana]] and its Prep poses, [[Śīrṣāsana]]I.
Stable: Wrist synergists, elbow synergists, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis flexors, protractors), external rotators of the arm, chest abdominals, hip adductors and flexors, pelvic floor, knee flexors, foot dorsiflexors.
Preparation: Add to [[Śīrṣāsana]] vinyasa; transition into asana from [[Adhomukhavṛkṣāsana]].

Name: Utthita Trivikrmasana
Etymology: Utthita = extended; Trivikrama = three steps (an epithet of Vishnu)

Name: Vasisthasana
Open: Shoulder elevators and retractors, chest.
Stable: Grounded leg: intrinsic foot muscles. Hip stabilizers, (emphasis abductors, external rotators of the leg). Extended leg: external rotators, hip flexors. Knee extensors, back extensors, transversus abdominis, obliques. Grounded arm: wrist synergists. Top arm: shoulder retractors, protractors, and flexors. Elbow extensors.

Name: Ardha Baddha Padma Paschimottanasana
Etymology: Ardha = half; Baddha = bound; Padma = lotus; Paścima = west; Uttāna = intense stretch

Name: Ardha Baddha Padmottanasana
Etymology: Ardha = half; Baddha = bound; Padma = lotus; Uttāna = intense stretch
Open: Standing leg: knee flexors, hip extensors. Folded leg: knee extensors, hip adductors, internal rotators of the leg. Back extensors, shoulder extensors of bound arm.
Stable: Standing leg: intrinsic muscles of foot, knee extensors, hip abductors, adductors and extensors, internal rotators of leg.
Preparation: Other [[Padmāsana]] poses: [[Kukkuṭāsana]], [[Ardhabaddhapadmapaścimottānāsana]]; [[Ardhabaddhapadmapaścimottānāsana]] to [[Chaturāṅgadaṇḍāsana]] (keeping Half Lotus positioning), to [[Adhomukhaśvānāsana]], hop forward to [[Tāḍāsana]]; [[Bharadvājāsana]].

Name: Baddha Konasana A
Open: Calves, knee flexors, hip extensors, shoulder extensors and retractors, internal rotators of the arm.
OpenAsana: [[Anāhatāsana]], [[Ardhottānāsana]], [[Bharmanāsana]], [[Phalakāsana]], [[Uttānāsana]], [[Anāhatāsana]]. For arms and shoulders these respective arm forms: [[Tāḍāsana]], [[Gomukhāsana B]], [[Garuḍāsana]].
Stable: Intrinsic foot muscles, internal rotators of the leg, hip flexors and adductors, back extensors, transversus abdominis, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis protractors, flexors), external rotators of the arm, elbow flexors, wrist flexors.
Preparation: Other back bends, such as [[Rājakapotāsana]], [[Bhekāsana]], [[Dhanurāsana]], [[Kapotāsana B]], [[Laghu Vajrāsana]],[[Rājakapotāsana]], [[Ūrdhva Dhanurāsana]].

Name: Baddha Konasana B
Open: Hip adductors, internal rotators of the leg, abdominals, chest.
OpenAsana: [[Baddhakoṇāsana B]] and its Prep poses, [[Suptapādāṅguṣṭhāsana A]], [[Vajrāsana A]], [[Utthitatrikoṇāsana]], [[Vīrabhadrāsana B]].
Stable: The strap and bolster.
StableAsana: In itself a restorative that can be practiced independently or after any practice.
Preparation: Practice with a block under the sacrum or along the spine between shoulder blades; place sandbags on the thighs, or bolster along the spine.

Name: Bhujapidasana
Open: Wrist flexors, shoulder retractors and elevators, hip extensors, back extensors, knee flexors.
Stable: Wrist synergists, elbow synergists, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis flexors, protractors), external rotators of the arm, chest, abdominals, hip adductors and flexors, pelvic floor, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors.

Name: Dandasana
Open: Calves, knee flexors, hip extensors, elbow flexors, shoulder elevators.
Stable: Hip flexors and adductors, internal rotators of the leg, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors, back extensors, transversus abdominis, shoulder synergists (emphasis protractors, retractors, extensors), external rotators of the arm.

Name: Garbha Pindasana
Open: Hip adductors and extensors, internal rotators of the leg, back extensors, shoulder retractors and elevators.
OpenAsana: [[Adhomukhaśvānāsana]], [[Agnistambhāsana]], [[Ardhabaddhapadmottānāsana]], [[Baddhakoṇāsana B]], [[Bālāsana]], [[Mālāsana]], [[Marīchyāsana A]], [[Pādāṅguṣṭhāsana]], [[Padmāsana]], [[Paścimottānāsana A]], [[Piṇḍāsana]], [[Prasāritapādottānāsana A]] and D, [[Ūrdhvamukhapaścimottānāsana]], [[Uttānāsana]].
Stable: Hip flexors, external rotators of the leg, pelvic floor, abdominals, back extensors, knee flexors, shoulder retractors and adductors, elbow flexors.

Name: Janu Sirsasana A
Open: Extended leg: calf, knee flexors, hip extensors. Folded leg: knee extensors, hip adductors, rotators, and extensors. Back extensors, shoulder retractors and elevators.
Stable: Hip flexors. Extended leg: internal rotators, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors. Folded leg: external rotators, knee flexors. Transversus abdominis, back extensors, obliques, shoulder depressors.
StableAsana: [[Baddhakoṇāsana B]], [[Daṇḍāsana]], [[Prasāritapādottānāsana A]], [[Prasāritapādottānāsana B]] and [[Prasāritapādottānāsana D]], [[Upaviṣṭhakoṇāsana A]], [[Uttānāsana]].

Name: Kukkutasana
Open: Hip adductors and extensors, internal rotators of the leg. Back extensors, chest, shoulder retractors and elevators, elbow flexors.
Stable: Wrist synergists, elbow synergists, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis flexors, protractors), external rotators of the arm, chest abdominals, hip adductors and flexors, pelvic floor, knee flexors, foot dorsiflexors.

Name: Kurmasana
Open: Hip adductors and extensors, internal rotators of the leg. Back extensors, shoulder retractors and elevators.
Stable: Hip synergists, external rotators of the leg, back extensors, abdominals, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis depressors, protractors), internal rotators of the arm, elbow extensors.

Name: Marichyasana A
Open: Grounded leg: calf, knee flexors. Gesture leg: knee extensors, external rotators. Hip extensors, back extensors, shoulder retractors, elevators.
Stable: Hip flexors and adductors. Extended leg: internal rotators, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors. Folded leg: internal rotators, knee flexors. Abdominals, back extensors, obliques, shoulder depressors and extensors, elbow flexors.

Name: Marichyasana C
Open: Grounded leg: calf, knee flexors. Gesture leg: knee extensors, external rotators. Hip extensors, back extensors, obliques, chest, shoulder retractors and elevators, throat.
OpenAsana: [[Marīchyāsana A]] and its Prep poses, [[Ardha Matsyendrāsana]].
Stable: Hip flexors and adductors. Extended leg: internal rotators, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors. Folded leg: hip abductors, knee flexors. Abdominals, back extensors, obliques, shoulder depressors and extensors, elbow flexors.
Counterposes: Symmetrical forward bends, [[Baddhakoṇāsana B]], [[Upaviṣṭhakoṇāsana A]], [[Baddhakoṇāsana B]].

Name: Navasana
Open: Hip extensors, knee flexors, back extensors, chest, shoulder retractors and elevators.
Stable: Hip flexors, adductors, internal rotators of the leg, knee extensors, calves, back extensors, transversus abdominis, shoulder protractors and retractors, external rotators of the arm.
Preparation: Transition to Ardha [[Nāvāsana]] with kapalabhati pranayama, then back up; press into [[Lolasana]] between rounds; [[Utplutiḥ]], [[Ubhayapādāṅguṣṭhāsana]], [[Ūrdhvamukhapaścimottānāsana]].

Name: Paschimottanasana A
Open: Calves, knee flexors, hip extensors, back extensors, shoulder retractors and elevators, chest, shoulder extensors.
Stable: Hip flexors, internal rotators of the leg, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors, transversus abdominis, back extensors, shoulder depressors.

Name: Pindasana
Open: Hip adductors and extensors, internal rotators of the leg, back extensors, shoulder retractors and elevators.
Stable: Shoulder stabilizers (emphasis retractors, adductors), back extensors, hip extensors, abdominals.

Name: Purvatanasana
Open: Foot dorsiflexors, hip flexors, abdominals, chest, shoulder flexors and elevators, throat.
Stable: Wrist synergists, internal rotators of the arm, shoulder stabilizers (emphasis retractors, depressors), throat, back extensors, transversus abdominis, hip extensors and adductors, calves.
StableAsana: [[Adhomukhaśvānāsana]], [[Ardhottānāsana]], [[Chaturāṅgadaṇḍāsana]], [[Daṇḍāsana]], [[Matsyāsana]], [[Nāvāsana]], [[Phalakāsana]], [[Śalabhāsana A]] and [[Śalabhāsana B]], [[Sarvāṅgāsana]], [[Ūrdhva Dhanurāsana]], [[Vajrāsana A]], [[Tāḍāsana]], [[Ūrdhva Dhanurāsana]], [[Ūrdhvamukhaśvānāsana]], [[Uṣṭrāsana]], [[Vasiṣṭhāsana]].

Name: Setu Bandhasana
Open: Foot dorsiflexors, knee flexors, hip flexors, abdominals, chest, shoulder retractors, throat.
Stable: Neck, shoulder protractors, retractors, and adductors, back extensors, transversus abdominis, hip extensors and adductors, internal rotators of the leg, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors.
StableAsana: [[Añjanēyāsana]], [[Ālāsana]], [[Bhekāsana]], [[Rājakapotāsana]], [[Bharmanāsana]], [[Dhanurāsana]], [[Ekapādarājakapotāsana]],[[Rājakapotāsana]], [[Ūrdhva Dhanurāsana]], [[Śalabhāsana A]] and [[Śalabhāsana B]], [[Śīrṣāsana]], [[Vajrāsana A]], [[Ūrdhva Dhanurāsana]], [[Ūrdhvamukhaśvānāsana]], [[Uṣṭrāsana]], [[Dvipādaviparītadaṇḍāsana]].

Name: Supta Padangusthasana A
English: Reclined Hand to Big Toe Pose A
Etymology: Supta = reclined; Pāda = foot; Aṅguṣṭha = big toe
Open: Grounded leg: foot dorsiflexors, knee flexors, hip flexors. Gesture leg: hip extensors, knee flexors. Back extensors, shoulder elevators, neck.
Stable: Grounded leg: hip extensors and adductors. Extended leg: hip flexors. Internal rotators of the leg, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors, obliques, transversus abdominis, shoulder retractors.
StableAsana: In itself a preparation and restorative lala hip extensors and calves. [[Adhomukhaśvānāsana]], [[Daṇḍāsana]], [[Tāḍāsana]], [[Ekapādabakāsana A]].

Name: Supta Padangusthasana B
English: Reclined Hand to Big Toe Pose B
Etymology: Supta = reclined; Pāda = foot; Aṅguṣṭha = big toe

Name: Tri-anga Mukha Eka Pada Pashchimottanasana
Etymology: Triaṅga = three limbs; Mukha = face; Eka = one; Pāda = foot; Paścima = west; Uttāna = intense stretch
Open: [[Vīrabhadrāsana A]] leg: foot dorsiflexors, knee extensors. Extended leg: calf, knee flexors. Hip extensors, back extensors, shoulder extensors, retractors, and elevators.
Stable: Hip flexors. Extended leg: internal rotators, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors. Folded leg: internal rotators, knee flexors. Hip adductors, transversus abdominis, back extensors, obliques, shoulder depressors.
StableAsana: [[Adhomukhaśvānāsana]], [[Bharadvājāsana]] and B, [[Bālāsana]], [[Daṇḍāsana]], [[Garuḍāsana]], [[Marīchyāsana A]] and C, [[Pādahastāsana]], [[Pādāṅguṣṭhāsana]], [[Parivṛttotkaṭāsana]], [[Paścimottānāsana A]], [[Vīrabhadrāsana A]].

Name: Ubhaya Padangusthasana
Etymology: Ubhaya = both; Pāda = foot; Aṅguṣṭha = big toe
Open: Hip extensors, back extensors, shoulder retractors, chest, shoulder elevators, knee flexors, foot dorsiflexors.
Stable: Hip flexors, adductors, internal rotators of the leg, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors, back extensors, abdominals, shoulder protractors and retractors, elbow extensors.

Name: Upavishta Konasana A
Open: Hip adductors and extensors, internal rotators of the leg, knee flexors, calves, back extensors, chest, elbow flexors.
Stable: Hip flexors, external rotators of the leg, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors, transversus abdominis, back extensors, shoulder retractors and adductors.
StableAsana: [[Adhomukhaśvānāsana]], [[Agnistambhāsana]], [[Ardhottānāsana]], [[Baddhakoṇāsana B]], [[Bālāsana]], [[Bharmanāsana]], [[Daṇḍāsana]], [[Mālāsana]], [[Pādāṅguṣṭhāsana]], [[Paścimottānāsana A]], [[Prasāritapādottānāsana D]], [[Suptapādāṅguṣṭhāsana A]], [[Ekapādabakāsana A]], [[Utthitahastapādāṅguṣṭhāsana A]] , [[Utthitatrikoṇāsana]], [[Vīrabhadrāsana B]].
Preparation: [[Kūrmāsana]], transition to [[Tiṭṭibhāsana A]] and [[Bhujapīḍāsana]], rock back to[[Suptakoṇāsana]], and up again.

Name: Urdhva Mukha Paschimottanasana
Etymology: Ūrdhva = upward; Mukha = face; Paścima = west; Uttāna = intense stretch
Open: Hip extensors, back extensors, shoulder retractors, chest, shoulder elevators, knee flexors, foot dorsiflexors.
Stable: Hip flexors, adductors, internal rotators of the leg, knee extensors, calves, back extensors, abdominals, shoulder protractors and retractors, elbow extensors.

Name: Utkatasana
Open: Calves, hip extensors, shoulder elevators, extensors, and retractors.
Stable: Intrinsic foot muscles, knee flexors, hip flexors and extensors, back extensors, transversus abdominis, shoulder protractors and flexors, internal rotators of the arm, elbow extensors.
Preparation: [[Parivṛttotkaṭāsana]], Parivrtta [[Ālāsana]]; transition to sitting on the heels.

Name: Utthita Hasta Padangusthasana A
English: Extended Hand to Big Toe Pose
Etymology: Utthita = extended; Hasta = hand; Pāda = foot; Aṅguṣṭha = big toe

Name: Utthita Hasta Padangusthasana B
English: Extended Hand to Big Toe Pose
Etymology: Utthita = extended; Hasta = hand; Pāda = foot; Aṅguṣṭha = big toe
Open: Standing leg: hip flexors. Gesture leg: hip adductors and extensors, internal rotators of the leg, shoulder retractors, chest, neck.
Stable: Standing leg: intrinsic foot muscles. Hip stabilizers, (emphasis adductors, internal rotators of the leg). Extended leg: hip flexors. Knee extensors, back extensors, transversus abdominis, obliques. Hasta arm: shoulder retractors, protractors, elbow extensors.
Preparation: Draw lifted leg higher without compromising alignment; release clasp of foot, hold lifted leg 5 breaths; Parvritta variation.

Name: Utthita Hasta Padangusthasana C
English: Extended Hand to Big Toe Pose
Etymology: Utthita = extended; Hasta = hand; Pāda = foot; Aṅguṣṭha = big toe

Name: Virabhadrasana A
Open: Foot dorsiflexors, knee extensors, hip abductors and flexors.
Stable: Hip flexors, internal rotators of the leg, knee flexors, transversus abdominis, shoulder retractors and protractors, elbow extensors.

Name: Virabhadrasana B
Open: Front leg: hip extensors, adductors, and internal rotators. Back leg: calf, knee flexors, hip adductors. Shoulder elevators and retractors, chest.
Stable: Intrinsic foot muscles. Front leg: hip stabilizers (emphasis extensors, adductors), external rotators of the leg, knee flexors. Back leg: hip extensors, knee extensors, foot dorsiflexors. Back extensors, transversus abdominis, obliques, shoulder abductors, retractors, and protractors, elbow extensors.
Preparation: Reverse Warrior, [[Utthitapārśvakoṇāsana]], [[Utthitatrikoṇāsana]], [[Ardhacandrāsana]], Svarga Dvijasana, Dancing Warrior series.

Name: Padahastasana
Open: Calves, knee flexors, hip extensors, back extensors, shoulder elevators, wrist extensors.
Stable: Hip flexors, internal rotators of the leg, rotators, knee extensors, intrinsic foot muscles, transversus abdominis, back extensors, shoulder depressors.

Name: Padangusthasana
Open: Calves, knee flexors, hip extensors, back extensors, shoulder elevators.
Stable: Hip flexors, internal rotators of the leg, knee extensors, intrinsic foot muscles, transversus abdominis, back extensors, shoulder depressors.

Name: Parivritta Parshvakonasana
Etymology: Parivṛtta = revolved; Pārśva = side; Koṇa = angle
Open: Front leg: calf, hip extensors, external rotators of the leg. Back leg: calf, knee flexors, hip flexors. Obliques, chest. Gesture arm: shoulder flexors. Grounded arm: shoulder elevators.
Stable: Intrinsic foot muscles. Front leg: hip stabilizers (emphasis flexors, adductors), knee flexors. Back leg: hip extensors, knee extensors, back extensors, transversus abdominis, obliques, shoulder retractors and protractors, neck.
StableAsana: [[Adhomukhaśvānāsana]], [[Añjanēyāsana]], [[Ardha Matsyendrāsana]], [[Ālāsana]], [[Marīchyāsana C]], [[Parivṛttahastapādāṅguṣṭhāsana]], [[Parivṛttotkaṭāsana]], [[Ekapādabakāsana A]], [[Vīrabhadrāsana A]] and [[Virabhadrāsana C]].
Preparation: Transition to [[Kouṇḍinyāsana B]], hold five breaths, then [[Chaturāṅgadaṇḍāsana]]; [[Mṛgāsana]], [[Marīchyāsana C]].

Name: Parivritta Trikonasana
Open: Front leg: calf, knee extensors, hip adductors and extensors, internal rotators of the leg. Back leg: calf, knee flexors, hip abductors and flexors, internal rotators of the leg. Obliques, chest, shoulder retractors and elevators, neck.
Stable: Intrinsic foot muscles. Front leg: hip stabilizers (emphasis flexors, adductors), knee extensors. Back leg: hip extensors, knee extensors, back extensors, transversus abdominis, obliques, shoulder retractors and protractors, elbow extensors, neck.

Name: Parsvottanasana
Open: Knee flexors, hip extensors, internal rotators of the leg, back extensors, chest, external rotators of the arm, shoulder flexors and elevators, wrist flexors.
Stable: Intrinsic foot muscles. Front leg: hip stabilizers (emphasis flexors, adductors), knee extensors. Back leg: hip extensors, knee extensors, back extensors, abdominals, obliques, shoulder retractors and protractors, internal rotators of the arm, elbow flexors.
Preparation: Transition to [[Parivṛttatrikoṇāsana]] and Prep poses for [[Hanumānāsana]], [[Vīrabhadrāsana A]] and [[Virabhadrāsana C]].

Name: Prasarita Padottanasana A
Etymology: Prasārita = spread out; Pāda = foot; Uttāna = intense stretch
Open: All variations: hip adductors and extensors, back extensors, shoulder elevators. C: shoulder flexors, elbow flexors.
Stable: Intrinsic foot muscles, knee extensors, hip stabilizers (emphasis flexors, adductors), transversus abdominis, back extensors, shoulder depressors. C: shoulder flexors.
Preparation: [[Uttānāsana]], [[Śīrṣāsana]], transition to [[Śīrṣāsana B]] arm balance vinyasa, [[Upaviṣṭhakoṇāsana A]], [[Bakāsana B]].

Name: Prasarita Padottanasana B
Etymology: Prasārita = spread out; Pāda = foot; Uttāna = intense stretch
Open: All variations: hip adductors and extensors, back extensors, shoulder elevators. C: shoulder flexors, elbow flexors.
Stable: Intrinsic foot muscles, knee extensors, hip stabilizers (emphasis flexors, adductors), transversus abdominis, back extensors, shoulder depressors. C: shoulder flexors.

Name: Prasarita Padottanasana C
Etymology: Prasārita = spread out; Pāda = foot; Uttāna = intense stretch
Open: All variations: hip adductors and extensors, back extensors, shoulder elevators. C: shoulder flexors, elbow flexors.
Stable: intrinsic foot muscles, knee extensors, hip stabilizers (emphasis flexors, adductors), transversus abdominis, back extensors, shoulder depressors. C: shoulder flexors.

Name: Prasarita Padottanasana D
Etymology: Prasārita = spread out; Pāda = foot; Uttāna = intense stretch
Open: All variations: hip adductors and extensors, back extensors, shoulder elevators. C: shoulder flexors, elbow flexors.
Stable: Intrinsic foot muscles, knee extensors, hip stabilizers (emphasis flexors, adductors), transversus abdominis, back extensors, shoulder depressors. C: shoulder flexors.

Name: Samasthiti
Open: Chest, shoulder elevators, mind.
Stable: Intrinsic foot muscles, knee extensors, hip synergists, transversus abdominis, back extensors, shoulder depressors, neck.

Name: Utthita Parshvakonasana
Etymology: Utthita = extended; Pārśva = side; Koṇa = angle
Open: Front leg: hip extensors and adductors, internal rotators of the leg. Back leg: knee flexors, hip flexors. Grounded elbow: flexors. Gesture elbow: flexors, shoulder extensors. Abdominals, chest, shoulder elevators.
Stable: Intrinsic foot muscles. Front leg: hip stabilizers (emphasis flexors, adductors), external rotators of the leg, knee flexors. Back leg: hip extensors, knee extensors, back extensors, transversus abdominis, obliques, shoulder retractors and protractors. Top arm: external rotators. Bottom arm: wrist synergists. Elbow extensors, neck.
Preparation: Wrap upper arm behind and lower arm under front leg, clasp wrist of upper arm, transition to [[Kouṇḍinyāsana A]] A or Svarga Dvijasana.

Name: Utthita Trikonasana
Open: Front leg: hip adductors and extensors, internal rotators of the leg, knee flexors. Back leg: hip flexors, knee flexors. Obliques, chest, shoulder elevators and retractors, neck.
Stable: Intrinsic foot muscles. Front leg: hip stabilizers (emphasis flexors, adductors), external rotators of the leg. Back leg: hip extensors. Knee extensors, back extensors, transversus abdominis, obliques, shoulder abductors, retractors, and protractors, elbow extensors, neck.
StableAsana: [[Adhomukhaśvānāsana]], [[Ardhottānāsana]], [[Ālāsana]], [[Bharmanāsana]], [[Prasāritapādottānāsana B]] and [[Prasāritapādottānāsana D]], [[Utthitapārśvakoṇāsana]], [[Vasiṣṭhāsana]], [[Vīrabhadrāsana A]] and [[Virabhadrāsana B]].
Preparation: Transition to [[Ardhacandrāsana]], keeping alignment of standing foot and hip.
